did.head: Collection Summary
did.abstract: Business records of the company pertaining to administration of its copper mines which included the Longfellow Mine, Coronado Mine, Metcalf Mine, Clay Mine, and Humboldt Mine. Records include financial journals, ledgers, cost statements; payroll records, including accident reports and industrial compensation; production and sales records and inventories. Also included are records of the Arizona and New Mexico Railway Company; Clifton Hospital; and Metcalf Hospital; which were owned by the company.

repository.label: Repository:
repository.corpname: University of Arizona Libraries, Special Collections

userestrict.head: Copyright
userestrict.p: It is the responsibility of the user to obtain permission to publish from the owner of the copyright (the institution, the creator of the record, the author or his/her transferees, heirs, legates, or literary executors). The user agrees to indemnify and hold harmless the Arizona Board of Regents for the University of Arizona, its officers, employees, and agents from and against all claims made by any person asserting that he or she is an owner of copyright.

prefercite.head: Credit Line
prefercite.p: Arizona Copper Company records (AZ 146). Special Collections, University of Arizona Libraries.

bioghist.head: Historical Note
bioghist.p: The Arizona Copper Company was a mining company of Edinburgh, Scotland, operating in the Clifton- Morenci area of Arizona from 1882-1921. The company was sold to Phelps Dodge Corporation in 1921.

arrangement.head: Organization
arrangement.p: This collection is organized into five series:

list.item: Series I: Financial Records and Related Material, 1882-1922
Series II: Arizona and New Mexico Railway Company Records, 1890-1919
Series III: Records of Injured Persons, 1912-1921
Series IV: Production and Sales Records, 1893-1921

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Note
scopecontent.p: Business records of the company pertaining to administration of its copper mines which included the Longfellow Mine, Coronado Mine, Metcalf Mine, Clay Mine, and Humboldt Mine. Records include financial journals, ledgers, cost statements; payroll records, including accident reports and industrial compensation; production and sales records and inventories. Also included are records of the Arizona and New Mexico Railway Company; Clifton Hospital; and Metcalf Hospital; which were owned by the company.

item.corpname: Arizona and New Mexico Railway Company

item.subject: Copper mines and mining -- Arizona -- History -- Sources
